Comments_List: I really did not gain very much from this course. There was a huge disconnect between lecture and homework assignments. I would say maybe a few Matlab techniques is what I gained.
A general overview of continuum and statistical mechanics, as well as some insight to biology terms and structures.

Some repetition of basic mechanic laws.
Use of mechanical laws for biology.
influence of entropy.

I really think that the layout of the class was awful. I wanted to learn more about biomechanics, meanwhile, the majority of the class was focused on deriving equations that I learned already in other courses. 

Another awful idea was to make the second lab assignment a "three hour assignment". This worked on the honesty system where students agreed they only worked on it for 3 hours. What this does is cause students who followed the rules to get a lower grade than students who broke the rules and spent more time on it.

Also, the homework was on a much harder level than any of the material taught in class. We never received homework solutions so there was no way to actually learn from the work that we did. 

Overall, if the course remains the same I would never recommend this course to anyone.
We used matlab tools like optimization and curve fitting that are extremely useful and I have applied on my own, after taking this class.

Strengths: Well structured, good teacher, good TAs, a lot to learn

Weakness: If you ever fall behind, you can't really grasp it afterwards due to missing solution of psets etc. and too vague answers of TAs
I would never. It was a waste of my time and energy to take this course. I did not learn anything meaningful
Take this course if you are interested in applying mechanical relations (stress, strain, modulus, elasticity concepts, etc) to biological systems.
